intro: Machaerina gracilis, commonly known as the slender machaerina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Machaerina gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
